intro: Gastrolobium grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered burr-pear, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring woody stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Gastrolobium grandiflorum is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
